dt: {bc}a flat usually paper container (as for a letter)

dt.t: the {wi}envelope{/wi} of air around the earth

dt: {bc}the bag containing the gas in a balloon or airship
{bc}a natural enclosing covering (such as a membrane, shell, or integument)
{bc}a lipoprotein unit membrane that forms the outer layer of some virions
{bc}a curve tangent to each of a family of curves
{bc}a surface tangent to each of a family of surfaces
{bc}a set of performance limits (as of an aircraft) that may not be safely exceeded
{bc}the set of operating parameters that exists within these limits

pt: The \ˈen-\ and \ˈän-\ pronunciations are used with about equal frequency, and both are fully acceptable, though the \ˈän-\ version is sometimes decried as "pseudo-French." Actually \ˈän-\ is exactly what one would expect to hear when a French word like {it}entrepreneur{/it} is becoming anglicized. {it}Envelope{/it}, however, has been in English for nearly 300 years, plenty of time for it to become completely anglicized and for both of its pronunciations to win respectability.

shortdef: a flat usually paper container (as for a letter)
the outer covering of an aerostat

dt: {bc}done quickly to provide a rough estimate {bc}not exact

dt.t: His method is, in effect, a {wi}back-of-the-envelope{/wi} time-and-motion study.

shortdef: done quickly to provide a rough estimate : not exact

dt: {bc}an envelope having an opening through which the address on the enclosure is visible

shortdef: an envelope having an opening through which the address on the enclosure is visible

dt: {bc}to go beyond the usual or normal limits by doing something new, dangerous, etc.

dt.t: a director who has {it}pushed the envelope{/it} in his recent films
a new airplane design that {it}pushes the envelope{/it}

shortdef: to go beyond the usual or normal limits by doing something new, dangerous, etc.

dt: {bc}an envelope that has an address on it and that can be used to mail something back to the person who sent it

shortdef: an envelope that has an address on it and that can be used to mail something back to the person who sent it

dt: {bc}a double membrane enclosing a cell nucleus and having its outer part continuous with the endoplasmic reticulum

shortdef: a double membrane enclosing a cell nucleus and having its outer part continuous with the endoplasmic reticulum —called also nuclear envelope
